translation: Hello, everyone!
transcript: 各位好！

translation: Today, I don't want to talk about dance,nor my identity, nor my dance achievements.
transcript: 不谈舞蹈，也不要再争议我的身份，也不要谈论我的舞蹈成就。

translation: I just want to talk about how to be a mother.
transcript: 我想谈的是，当妈。

translation: As everybody knows from news reports I have adopted three children who have no blood ties with me.
transcript: 收养了三个孩子，其实大家都知道的，新闻上都看多了，收养了三个孩子，三个孩子完全不没有，不搭嘎的三个孩子。

translation: It is precisely the three who taught me how to be a mother.
transcript: 恰恰这三个孩子教会了我去怎么去做一个妈。

translation: Before raising them, I was completely unconcerned about education.
transcript: 当我带三个孩子的同时呢，其实我知道以前不关心教育。

translation: In our time to receive education, the social environment was relatively simple, and the information we received was what the state selected for us.
transcript: 在我们接受教育那个时候，社会环境相对简单，信息量也是国家替你选择性的你接受信息。

translation: But now, even if we close our eyes and think about nothing, the information is still pouring into our ears.
transcript: 现在可不是，你闭着眼睛，就是你什么都不想，信息还在往你耳朵里灌。

translation: When it comes to this era, we always seem to complain about the education system.
transcript: 说这个时代的时候，其实我们老在抱怨好像是教育体制有问题。

translation: Before walking onto the stage, I was thinking that is there anything wrong with our education system?
transcript: 刚才我在上台之前我在想，是我们教育体制有问题？

translation: I don’t think so.
transcript: 不是。

translation: Times have changed, so have people’s demands.
transcript: 时代变了，人们的要求变了。

translation: But our educational concepts and institutions have kept unchanged.
transcript: 但是我们的教育观念、体制没有变。

translation: When a child is successfully admitted to a key middle school or a good university, or studys abroad in the United States.
transcript: 当你一个孩子成功的时候，考上一个重点中学，考上一个很好的大学，到美国留学都非常好时候。

translation: His parents would sing their own praises, saying they have made great sacrifices for their child and all the success their child made is to their credit, or exclaim how successful their education is.
transcript: 这时候父母之间谈论的是，哎呀，你看我们，我赋予孩子付出了多少，我们教育多么成功，都是父母的功劳。

translation: It is rarely said that such success results from the school.
transcript: 没有很少说，哎呦，我们这学校培养得太好了。

translation: Of course, there are still some owing this accomplishment to teachers.
transcript: 也有，我们的老师，孩子碰到很好的老师，怎么怎么的。

translation: But if this child fails or is admitted to a less good school, they would complain a lot, criticizing the exam-oriented education and the college entrance examination and assuming the education system is the root cause.
transcript: 但是如果这孩子不好或者是失败了，大家都有一大堆的话要说，说的我们应试教育不对，高考不对，教育体制不对，一切的问题全都。

translation: So China's education system is a target.
transcript: 教育中国的教育体制就是一个靶子。

translation: Yes, I think it is.
transcript: 是，我赞同。

translation: If our education system is a target that can give parents an excuse, we can blame the target and everyone has this right.
transcript: 如果是那是一个靶子的话，我们可以埋怨到靶子上，可以给作为父母找个借口的靶子的话，每个人都有这个权利。

translation: However, I think it is too late to blame.
transcript: 但是我觉得那已经来不及了。

translation: All right, I'm going to share three stories.
transcript: 好，我讲三个故事。

translation: I remember when my eldest son was in the top class in kindergarten, all teachers told me that all the other children were taking extra lessons, and the dean himself said to me, "Mrs. Jin, it's time for your son to take some extra lessons."
transcript: 大儿子上幼儿园的时候，我记得老师们都说别的孩子在上大班的时候都要去补课，院长亲自跟我说：“金老师，你该给你儿子补补课了。”

translation: I said, "what extra lessons?"
transcript: 我说：“补什么课？”

translation: "Lessons about pinyin or whatever else, without these lessons your son will fall behind in primary school."
transcript: “补拼音哪，补什么什么都可以，要不他上小学跟不上的。”

translation: And I said, "I don't believe it."
transcript: 当时我说：“我不信。”

translation: But I was wrong.
transcript: 但是我错了。

translation: When my son came home on his first day of the first grade in primary school, he was confused and asked, "Mom, what's going on here? Here, this is called bpmf, but at this side it's called abcd. Which one should I follow?"
transcript: 当我孩子上了一年级的时候，儿子回来第一天就跟我说：“妈妈，这怎么回事儿，这这个叫做bpmf，这面叫做abcd，我该读哪一个？”

translation: I said, "Oh, forget the abcd and learn the bpmf first."
transcript: 我发现，我说啊，我说：“把abcd先扔掉，先给我念那个bpmf。”

translation: Then, I had a private talk with the teacher of the school.
transcript: 所以当时我就跟学校老师私人谈话。

translation: I said, "As a Chinese primary school, can our teachers teach English after the third grade instead of the first grade? Can we just learn bpmf before learning English?"
transcript: 我说：“能不能咱们中国的小学教育三年级以后再教英文，不要一年级教教英文，要先把bpmf学会了再教英文呢？”

translation: The teacher said, "I'm afraid this is unrealistic, Mrs. Jin. The fact is that only your child is like this, and all other children have learned bpmf in kindergarten. Why didn't your child learn?"
transcript: 老师说的：“那没办法金老师，你的孩子，人家幼儿园全解决，为什么你孩子不解决？”

translation: I said, "Why should a kindergarten teach children bpmf when they should play?"
transcript: 我说：“凭什么幼儿园小教孩子学bpmf呀，幼儿园就应该让孩子玩儿的时候。”

translation: "Well, your son has already lost at the starting line," he said.
transcript: 他说：“那你儿子已经在输在起跑线上了。”

translation: I asked, "Starting line? Set by who?"
transcript: 我说：“谁定的起跑线上啊？”

translation: To be frank, I really want to slap this setter.
transcript: 我说这个起跑线谁定的呀，我说出来我抽死他。

translation: I said, "Why should children learn bpmf in kindergartens at the age when they should play? Why do primary school teachers teach abcd instead of bpmf? Who made this rule?"
transcript: 我我说：“凭什么让孩子幼儿园不玩儿，让他学bpmf到学校老师就不教了，abcd一起给了，我说谁定的规矩呀？”

translation: In 2008, my eldest son was just in the second grade.
transcript: 08年的时候孩子就回来了，上刚上二年级。

translation: One day he came home from school and said, "Mom, I am going to write a composition today."
transcript: 我大儿子跟我说的：“我今天要写篇作文。”

translation: What kind of composition?
transcript: 什么作文呢？

translation: My Olympic Dream.
transcript: 我的奥运梦想。

translation: I asked him, "Do you know what the Olympics is?"
transcript: 我说：“你知道什么叫奥运会吗？”

translation: My son answered, "I don't know, but I see it on TV every day. There are five rings."
transcript: 我儿子说的：“不知道，反正电视里天天播奥运奥运的，有五个环儿。”

translation: Then I kept asking, "Do you have any dream?"
transcript: 我说：“你有梦想吗？”

translation: He replied, "No, I don’t."
transcript: 他说：“我没有梦想。”

translation: Then I told him to write like that "Olympic dream, I have no dream."
transcript: 我说那你就写上“奥运梦想，我没有梦想。”

translation: He said, "Mom, I will get a zero for such a composition."
transcript: 他说：“妈妈，这样我作文得不了分的。”

translation: I asked, "So do you have a dream? If you have, write it; if no, how do you write?"
transcript: 我说：“那你有梦想吗，你有梦想就写梦想，没梦想就写梦想。”

translation: There is no doubt that my son’s composition got a zero on the next day.
transcript: 第二天回去当然我儿子作文肯定是零分了。

translation: The teacher said to him, "You can make up a dream!"
transcript: 老师说：“你可以编哪！”

translation: I said to my son, "I'd rather you get a zero than make up anything."
transcript: 从这一天开始起，我说的：“儿子，妈妈宁可要你要零分，你也不能编故事。”

translation: It’s okay to have no dream, but never make up one or expect I can help you.
transcript: 你没有梦想就是没有梦想，这你编是你编的，妈妈帮你一起编我是更不行了。

translation: I will never do that.
transcript: 我是不可能编的。

translation: From that day on, almost all my son's compositions hardly scored a point.
transcript: 从这天开始起我儿子几乎的作文都没有打过分的。

translation: Among his compositions, only those wrote in the last year were better, because what he wrote was his attachment with me, which spoke his mind.
transcript: 因为所有的作文，唯独去年的作文好一点，因为他写和妈妈的感情时候，他写的还比较真挚。

translation: Just as the case of Olympic dream, he didn't write about his feelings about the Expo 2010, because I didn't take him to watch the Expo.
transcript: 写奥运梦想他写不出来没让他写，写世博感想他也没写，因为我没带他去看世博。

translation: I said, "did you watch the Expo?"
transcript: 我说：“你去看了吗？”

translation: "I didn't," he said.
transcript: 他说：“我没看。”

translation: "So why do you write? How can you write about your feelings since you haven't watched the Expo?"
transcript: “那我那你写什么世博呀，你看到了你才能写，你没看到你写什么呀！”。

translation: "The teacher said, ‘just copy something.'"
transcript: “老师说‘随便抄吧’。”

translation: Later I found that my son ranked at the bottom of the class in composition writing.
transcript: 后来发现我儿子在班里的作文是后几名的。

translation: What did the teacher do to the students at the bottom?
transcript: 后几名的学生老师采取什么方式呢？

translation: The teacher would ask them to copy others' compositions to pass the exam.
transcript: 拿一个作文本给你划几个在那儿抄几个作文吧，这样就勉强过了全班的考试。

translation: As such, the teaching results can be improved and the teacher could be called capable.
transcript: 全班的教学成绩能上去，老师也就免责了。

translation: I got goosebumps knowing that, but there is nothing I can do.
transcript: 我看完以后我浑身起鸡皮疙瘩，但我没办法。

translation: I talked to my son about this every day, so as you can see in my previous interview I said that the requirement for my three children is to pass the exam.
transcript: 这个话题天天在给儿子谈，所以说你们以前看到我采访的时候，我对我家三个孩子的要求就是考试及格。

translation: I think it's enough to get cut off scores.
transcript: 过那个水水平线就可以了。

translation: They asked why and one of my sons refuted me, "Mom, the existence of the first one means there is the last one."
transcript: 他们说为什么呀，我儿子就会说了：“妈妈，总有打头儿总有最后的吧。”

translation: I said, "sweet, learning is like swimming. 60 points means that you can pop your head out of the water and breathe. Only in this way can you swim a long distance and it’s okay to swim slowly. Otherwise you have to hold your breath underwater and you won't hold it long."
transcript: 我说的：“儿子，学习成绩就跟游泳一样，你60分你的头就浮出水面了，你可以喘气儿了，你可以游的很长，游慢点没关系，但是你不在60分儿你就憋气，你憋不长的。”

translation: My son said, "ah, I see."
transcript: 我儿子说：“啊明白了。”

translation: It doesn't matter if you can't swim fast as long as you don't drown in the water.
transcript: 慢儿慢儿游，游不快不关没关系，你淹不下去就可以了。

translation: So he knows what I mean.
transcript: 所以他这个概念就知道了，他说啊好了。

translation: From the first grade to the fifth grade, my son has constantly improved his final exam scores, starting from 60 to an average score of 85 or even 87 in the final graduation exam in the fifth grade. I applaud him for making such progress.
transcript: 从小所以当我儿子从一年级到五年级的时候，每次期末考试从六十分儿起价开始，一直到最后五年级毕业时候，他的平均分数已经到八十五分八十七分的时候我给我儿子鼓掌了。

translation: Because I didn't get him a private teacher or put him in any cram school.
transcript: 因为我没有请过一天家教，没有给他报过任何补习班。

translation: All his achievements were made by himself.
transcript: 完全靠他自己来学。

translation: When he complained, "mom, I have too much homework to do."
transcript: 他说作业太多，他说妈妈作业太多我写不了。

translation: I said, "forget it."
transcript: 我说：“那就不写啦。”

translation: When he said, "I'm too tired to go to school."
transcript: 完他说：“我太累了。”

translation: I said, "how about playing at home?"
transcript: 我说：“那咱就不上学了，在家玩儿吧。”

translation: He said, "no, I have to go to school."
transcript: 他说：“不行，我还要上学。”

translation: I said, "okay, then go to the school."
transcript: 我说：“好，那就还去上学。”

translation: Maybe I'm too much of a maverick. When he has too much homework to do, I would write on the book of parents signing that "sorry, teacher! There is too much homework for my son to finish."
transcript: 作业这么多，完以后他作业写不出来，也许我这个妈也太特立独行了，我在小孩儿每天签字本嘛，我每天要签字的，我就写了个：“老师对不起！作业太多，儿子写不了。”

translation: Well, I wouldn't suggest that you follow what I did.
transcript: 我我不建议都像我这么学。

translation: It's just my own experience of raising children.
transcript: 但是是我金星我带孩子是我讲我的经验。

translation: You know, children nowadays have a lot of computer homework, right?
transcript: 孩子们现在有很多电脑作业对吧。

translation: Teachers ask the parents to receive the homework on computers and send it back after students finish it.
transcript: 老师分析就是回去上电脑，家校们把电脑那个作业调出来，打成电脑再转回来。

translation: But my kids are not allowed to use computer or Ipad until today.
transcript: 我们家孩子到现在不许碰电脑，不许玩Ipad。

translation: Because I believe that their retina is not fully developed  before the age of 12, and TV and computer will affect its healthy growth.
transcript: 因为我相信一个道理，孩子在12岁以前视网膜还没有成熟之前，电视电脑太多的会影响他的视网膜的健康的成长的。

translation: Some children wear glasses for hereditary reasons.
transcript: 有些孩子戴眼镜是因为遗传基因的原因。

translation: But if they don’t have this gene, why don't you protect them?
transcript: 但是后天如果孩子没有这个基因，你干嘛不保护他呢？

translation: I think this is my duty.
transcript: 这是我的一个职责。

translation: However, I have to ease the control of my children when they turn 12 years old.
transcript: 12岁以后我抓不住了。

translation: I told my son that he would use computers all his life since 15 or 16.
transcript: 我说孩子从十五六岁以后你这一辈子要跟电脑打交道的。

translation: So what's the hurry?
transcript: 着什么急呀？我就跟我儿子说。

translation: When my daughter was in second and third grades, I was too tired to take care of her, so I sent her to my mother.
transcript: 我女儿呢，因为二年级三年级实在我太累了，那个时候带不了，就把女儿送到我妈妈那儿去了。

translation: Older people are more inclined to pamper children.
transcript: 老人一带孩子就不管了。

translation: So my mother allowed my daughter to watch TV with her, causing my daughter to wear glasses two years later.
transcript: 老人看电视孩子也跟着看电视，看了两年电视女儿回来戴上眼镜儿了。

translation: A few days ago, I took her to buy glasses.
transcript: 前两天因为回来以后我就给配眼镜。

translation: The doctor said she was only ten years old and the shortsightedness could be corrected even at the age of 12.
transcript: 完医生说她现在才十岁，十二岁的还能矫正过来。

translation: So we decided to try some vision correction methods, but it didn’t work after a period of time.
transcript: 我就跟女儿说那走吧去吧，去了以后一看没有变化。

translation: What can I do to stop my daughter from watching TV?
transcript: 那我怎么叫女儿不要看电视呢？

translation: What should I do when she wants to watch TV or to play video games?
transcript: 她想看电视孩子想看电视，想看玩儿些游戏机我怎么办呢？

translation: Finally I found a special way.
transcript: 我就用我特殊的方法。

translation: Whenever my makeup artist came to my house to help me prepare for TV programmes, my daughter would be there, watching the makeup artist putting false eyelashes on me.
transcript: 每天只要我做节目，我的化妆师到我家来给我化上妆，坐在那儿完给我粘假睫毛的时候，我女儿在那儿看。

translation: I asked her, "do you know why I wear false eyelashes?"
transcript: 我说：“为什么妈妈为什么要粘假睫毛？”

translation: She answered, "because they make you more beautiful!"
transcript: 她说：“美呀！漂亮啊！”

translation: I continued asking, "do you want to wear false eyelashes in the future?"
transcript: 我说：“你将来想粘假睫毛吗？”

translation: She said, "yes."
transcript: 她说：“我也想。”

translation: So I took a pair of glasses and said, "look, I can't wear false eyelashes if I put on my glasses."
transcript: 我就拿了一个眼镜儿带上，我说：“你看，戴上眼镜睫毛就粘不上去了。”

translation: The night before, when I was preparing for this speech, I had a talk with my three children.
transcript: 前天晚上在做这个讲课之前，我做功课的时候，跟三个孩子开了个家长会。

translation: Do you know what we talked?
transcript: 什么问题呢？

translation: As you know, I've been on a lot of TV shows and interviews recently.
transcript: 大家都知道最近我在电视上曝光特别多，访谈也特别多。

translation: My youngest son, a nine-year-old third-grade child, has known that I adopted him and his non-biological siblings.
transcript: 小儿子九岁三年级的孩子就知道了他们三个孩子的身世。

translation: Children say what they like.
transcript: 就同学们开玩笑童言无忌嘛。

translation: His classmates joked with him, "I just know you're an orphan, you're an orphan, you're an orphan!"
transcript: 对小儿子说：“我才知道你是个孤儿，你是个孤儿，你是个孤儿！”

translation: My son can't stand hearing that.
transcript: 小孩儿这么喊，儿子就受不了。

translation: So we talked about this.
transcript: 但之前我们谈论这个话题。

translation: How do you respond when someone provokes you and is rude to you?
transcript: 当有人挑衅你的时候，对你不礼貌，你怎么办呢？

translation: I told him that you had to learn patience.
transcript: 我就跟他说我说要忍。

translation: But if being provoked over and over again, you must hit back.
transcript: 忍一忍二但是不能忍三，如果三他还挑衅你的话，反击回去。

translation: Unlike me, a Chinese mother, their German dad takes a different approach.
transcript: 一个中国妈妈，一个德国爸爸，反击的方式不一样。

translation: He asked, "what should I do if someone bullies me?"
transcript: 他说：“别人孩子欺负我怎么办呢？”

translation: I said, "hit back!"
transcript: 我说：“打回去！”

translation: A typical Chinese mother.
transcript: 中国妈。

translation: The German dad said, "no, you need to leave him alone. If he bickers with you, just walk away. When he gets bored, he won't bother you."
transcript: 德国人说的：“不行，你别理他，他吵你，你躲开他，他无趣了他就好了。”

translation: Today, I came here at four o'clock. But in the first three hours before my speech, I went home at 2:30 after I finished my dancing practice, because my kids will come back from school at 2:30 every Friday.
transcript: 今天，在我来做讲坛的前三个小时，因为四点钟我来这儿报道，两点半我练完功回到家，因为孩子星期五放学两点半回来。

translation: When I entered the house, my youngest son blushed and said, "mom, I have a very good mood today."
transcript: 一进家门我的小三儿脸红扑扑的说的：“妈妈今天我心情特别好。”

translation: I asked, "wow, what makes you so happy?"
transcript: 我说：“你为什么好啊？”

translation: "When I went to school today, I found dad's approach worked."
transcript: “今天我到学校的时候，我觉得爸爸的方法很好。”

translation: I said, "what's the matter?"
transcript: 我说：“又怎么啦？”

translation: He said, "One of my classmates provoked me today, but I just ignored him. Then he tried to pull me. I said to him, 'You are so bored,', and he turned round and left."
transcript: 他说：“有个同学挑衅我，我一没理他二没理他，我三还没理他，最后同学扒拉我的时候，我说了一句‘你好无聊啊’，这个同学转身就走了。”

translation: Now, my son is at a transition from primary to junior middle school.
transcript: 我儿子现在小升初里头。

translation: I'm going to make an analysis.
transcript: 我要分析下。

translation: At this grade, students of class one and class two were all selected by placement exams.
transcript: 他们小升初一班二班全都是各个家长经过考试进来的孩子。

translation: But in class three there are only 14 students including my son.
transcript: 但是我儿子这个三班只有十四名学生。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么呢？

translation: The 14 students didn’t take such exams and were selected by computers, by which they were put in where their hukou (registered permanent residence)  is located.
transcript: 这十四名学生是没有家长考，完全是电脑筛选，我们家的户口在那个区就给孩子放到。

translation: So this is a backward class consisting of 14 students.
transcript: 十四个孩子，是个落后班，是个落后班，就拖油瓶的,在后边儿耷拉着的。

translation: But of the 14 students, my son ranks at the top.
transcript: 在这个落后班十四个学生当中，我儿子学习成绩是名列前茅的。

translation: I asked my son, "do you feel embarrassed in this class?"
transcript: 完以后我说的：“你觉得不好意思吗？”

translation: He said, "no, but I think there is something wrong with my classmates."
transcript: 他说：“没有”，他说的：“但是我们同学有问题。”

translation: I said, "what’s wrong with them?"
transcript: 我跟我说：“你同学有什么问题？”

translation: He answered, "their learning attitude is not right."
transcript: 他说：“他们的学习态度有问题。”

translation: I said, "Why do you think so?"
transcript: 我说：“为什么？”

translation: "Every time we have a class, they don't pay attention to what teachers are saying and always look back at the clock on the wall and say, 'can we just get the class over? '"
transcript: “每次我们上课的时候，所有男的女同他们不好，他们每次回头看那个钟，说‘能不能赶紧下课呀。’”

translation: I clapped for my son at once and said, "this is an important matter. You can tell your classmates have a wrong learning attitude, which is much more important than the scores."
transcript: 哦，我当时就给儿子鼓掌，我说儿子这个事儿特别重要，我说：“你知道你能分辨出同学的学习态度不对，这个比分数更重要。”

translation: But then I said, "What about your attitude?"
transcript: 但是我说： “你的态度呢？”

translation: He said, "I just learn and don't care about them."
transcript: 他说的： “我学到就完事儿了。”

translation: Then I asked, "how do you communicate with your classmates?"
transcript: 我说：“那你跟同学怎么交流呢？”

translation: "I communicate with them if we have to," he answered.
transcript: 他说：“那我跟他们交流，上课有话说没话就不说了。”

translation: I said, "don't you feel lonely as your classmates don't play with you?"
transcript: 我说：“那你不觉得孤单吗？同学没跟你玩儿的。”

translation: "We don't have common topics to talk about," he said.
transcript: 他说：“我们俩谈的谈的也不一样。”

translation: As a 12-year-old child, he can chat with me like that.
transcript: 一个十二岁的孩子能够跟我这么聊天。

translation: I think he has the basic ability to judging.
transcript: 我说那好，他基本的判断力有了。

translation: For a mother, what I can do is to help my kids build their own values.
transcript: 作为母亲来讲，我能做到的是来把孩子建立一个价值、观念就可以了，这是我能做到的。

translation: In fact, children often develop habits from our adult habits.
transcript: 其实孩子们很多习惯其实我们大人。

translation: And who cultivated these habits, the parents. I hope that we can respect their choices and don’t change their choices according to our own thoughts or because of our vanity and the social vanity.
transcript: 我们家长如果想跟大家共享的话不要用我们大人的想法、虚荣，社会的虚荣来改变孩子他本身的选择，你要尊重他的选择，而这个习惯是谁建立的，家长建立起来的。

translation: Now young people complain about the high cost of raising children.
transcript: 现在年轻人说养孩子费用太高。

translation: But they are totally wrong.
transcript: 全都是大人的失误。

translation: Because it is unreasonable to design children-raising cost based on the cost standard for adults.
transcript: 因为你们按照大人的生活成本设计这个孩子的成长成本这是错误的。

translation: I have set a standard for my children when educating them. Don't be a pain in the neck in society.
transcript: 我对我儿子和子女的教育成长的标准是你们有一天走到社会上，这三个孩子不叫人讨厌，我就可以了。

translation: If my children are annoying when they enter the society, they have really fallen behind at the starting line because they are unpopular.
transcript: 孩子走入社会以后他是个讨厌的人的话，他其实真正的起跑线上咱们所谓他就失去了，因为他不让人喜欢。

translation: If your manners of speech and behavior make others comfortable, you have the opportunity to take the first step in starting a business or doing anything.
transcript: 你的举止你的言谈让别人看得很舒服，这是你开始创业做任何事情的第一步。

translation: Who can help take the first step?
transcript: 那这第一步是谁教的？

translation: School?
transcript: 指望学校吗？

translation: Unrealistic.
transcript: 够呛。

translation: So I want to be the one that helps my children establish right values, moral standards and attitudes, which are enough for them in the future development.
transcript: 我要抢的是一个价值观一个道德标准，然后一个态度，这个就可以了。

translation: Whether it is about being ourselves or educating children, we have to learn to do subtraction in life rather than multiplication or addition.
transcript: 生活当中如果在我们每个人在教育孩子的同时，做自己的同时要学会做减法，就可以了，不要再做乘法、加法，减法，往下摘，摘下来，放下。

translation: Art creation has given me a lot of inspirations.
transcript: 而且在艺术创作当中，也给我很大的启示。

translation: It's particularly easy to make things complicated because we are best at it.
transcript: 复杂特别容易，人们把事情变复杂是人的一个最能干的。

translation: But it is no mean feat to simplify complex things.
transcript: 但是把复杂事情办成变成简单化，这是比较难的一件事情。

translation: When seeing me on the TV screen serving as a judge or participating in the show, you may think that I’m a busy bee.
transcript: 你们看到电视屏幕上觉得金老师特别忙，做这个评委做那个节目。

translation: But no, I'm not that busy and I just travel  between home and work places.
transcript: 没有，我没那么忙，两点一线。

translation: This morning I went to the rehearsal room to practice dancing and got home at 2:30.
transcript: 今天早上我还到排练室去练功，练完功以后两点半回到家。

translation: After this speech, I have finished my work today.
transcript: 今天晚上做这么讲座，完事儿了。

translation: Tomorrow is the weekend and I'll stay at home.
transcript: 明天早上我还是周末我一定要在家休息，雷打不动的。

translation: Now my career is in a rising trend. It seems that I can make money every day on various Chinese TV programs.
transcript: 那金老师就现在这个上升的趋势好像是我天天可以，到全中国各个卫视做节目可以赚钱。

translation: Yes, but I think there's no end to making money.
transcript: 是的，但是我觉得这是没止境的。

translation: When I made a lot of money, my son will be 17 years old.
transcript: 当我的这个钱赚到了以后，我的儿子已经长到十七岁了。

translation: It is unacceptable for me to be absent from his growth from 12 to 17.
transcript: 那从十二岁到十七岁我是没有接触的，这个不行。

translation: I think I can make money on a long term basis after my son is 18.
transcript: 我说那个钱以后细水儿长流，等我儿子十八岁以后，我再慢慢儿赚那个钱也可以。

translation: But until then, I will spend my time with my children.
transcript: 我说这个时间属于我和我孩子的。

translation: This is unchangeable.
transcript: 雷打不动的。

translation: Don't assume your children will only communicate with you when they grow up. The communication between parents and children begins when children are born.
transcript: 父母跟孩子交流是从他生下来开始，千万不要以为孩子长大了以后你才可以交流。

translation: Children grow up with all sense organs open to receive information.
transcript: 孩子长大的过程当中，他的天线是张开的，触角全部张开的。

translation: When they can speak and repeat what adults say, they will give back what they have received in their upbringing.
transcript: 等他说话的时候，他在重复大人的言谈的时候，他会把你给灌输的信息一天一个一个地还给你的。

translation: Therefore, I speak from personal experience. It's better for parents and soon-to-be parents to directly communicate with their children, treat them as growing-ups and don't talk to them like a child.
transcript: 所以我觉得已经成为父母的人或者即将成为父母的人，这是我一个个人经验之谈，对孩子一定要产生正面的交流，把他当作一个成长一个人，不要跟他说孩子的话。

translation: I have three children and I have never said to them like these "baby, drink this", "oh, don't do that".
transcript: 我这到目前为止养了三个孩子，我没有一天给我孩子说“宝宝喝这个”“哦，不要这个”。

translation: Never.
transcript: 我从来没有这么说话。

translation: It's not so much that I teach my children, but more that they have told me how to communicate with them in their growing-up years.
transcript: 其实不是我教育孩子，孩子告诉了我一个生命的成长过程当中我们应该去怎么去交流。

translation: This kind of communication and reflection also told me how to talk with others.
transcript: 这种交流、反思也告诉了你，你应该是怎么去跟其他人对话。

translation: When I reflect on this, I found that my children gave me an answer to the question "who shaped our children? The society?"
transcript: 这个价值观反思的时时候呢，孩子也教会了我，跟谁抢孩子，跟社会抢孩子吗？

translation: No, it comes down to our own values.
transcript: 不是，归根到底是跟你自己的一个价值观。

translation: Because my values and judgment are influenced by the society, and in the end it's me who can shape my children.
transcript: 因为我的价值观我的判断也是受社会的影响，最后还是跟你自己在抢孩子。

translation: What matters most is that you know what values you should infuse to your children.
transcript: 你把什么样的价值观灌输给孩子，就可以了。

translation: Thank you for your time.
transcript: 谢谢各位的时间。

translation: Thank you.
transcript: 谢谢。
